chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Deanna Marie Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Deanna M. Johnson in court with attorney Thomas A Starr.  Defendant Deanna M. Johnson in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites agreement.
DE entered plea of NC to 15 CF 255 count 2, 15 CF 204 count 3 , 15 CF 154 and 17 CF 12 count 1.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court asks Atty Starr if he was satisfied that his client knowingly and freely was entering into this agreement.  Atty Starr states yes.    Court further addressed the DE.
  Court finds defendant guilty count 2 in 15 CF 255, count 3 in 15 CF 204, 15 CF 154 and count 1 in 17 CF 12.

Court:  15 CF 255 count 2:  9 months county jail with credit for 27 days time served good time and huber to begin on/before 5/26/17 at 3:00 pm - DE will obtain day for day credit if successfully completes inpatient treatment - fine/costs $579.00 counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read-in

15 CF 204 count 3:  Sentence w/held probation 4 years - fine/costs $1630.50 - 90 days consecutive to 15 CF 255  county jail credit for 2 days time served  - any counseling DOC may recommend - AODA and follow thru - pshychological assessment - take all medication as prescirbed and as prescribed- cognitive behavioral class - no possession of illegal drugs - not to enter an establsihment that sells alcohol for consumption on the premises- counts 1, 2 and 4 are dismissed and read-in - consecutive to 15 CF 255  / 16 CF 36 - 16 CM 136, 16 CT 216 are dismissed and read-in

15 CF 154:   Sentence w/held probation 4 years - fine/costs $1630.50 - Restitution to LCO of $80.00 - any counseling DOC may recommend - 16 days credit time served if probation is revoked -   concurrent to 15 CF 204  / 16 CF 36 - 16 CM 136, 16 CT 216 are dismissed and read-in


17 CF 12 count 1 :   Sentence w/held probation 4 years - fine/costs $654.00- -  any counseling DOC may recommend - count 2 is dismissed and read-in -  concurrent to 15 CF 204 and 15 CF 154  / 16 CF 36 - 16 CM 136, 16 CT 216 are dismissed and read-in
